content: If you were to stack one million US pennies on top of each other, how tall would the stack be (in meters)?

Assuming that each US penny has a thickness of approximately 1.52 mm, a stack of one million pennies would be about 1,520,000 mm tall. To convert this to meters, we divide by 1,000, which gives us a height of 1,520 meters. So, the stack would be approximately 1,520 meters tall.
